kickstart.post:
### Create the Condor User /usr/sbin/useradd -u 407 -c "Condor Daemon Account" condor
### Put the CondorMaster into the database CMaster=&Kickstart_PublicHostname; /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_Master value=$CMaster /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_Network value=private /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_Daemons value="MASTER, STARTD" /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_PortLow value="40000" /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_PortHigh value="50000" /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_HostAllow value="+" /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_PasswordAuth value="no" /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add attr Condor_EnableMPI value="no"
# turn on Condor Client for compute nodes /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr compute Condor_Client value=true # modify set of daemons running on master /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr frontend Condor_Daemons value="MASTER, SCHEDD, COLLECTOR, NEGOTIATOR" # bind the network to the public interface /opt/rocks/bin/rocks add appliance attr frontend Condor_Network value=public
#!/bin/sh
LOCAL_DIR=/var/opt/condor rm -rf $LOCAL_DIR mkdir -p $LOCAL_DIR mkdir $LOCAL_DIR/log mkdir $LOCAL_DIR/spool mkdir $LOCAL_DIR/cred_dir mkdir $LOCAL_DIR/execute
chown -R condor.condor $LOCAL_DIR chmod a+rx $LOCAL_DIR
/opt/rocks/bin/rocks sync users > /dev/null 2>&1
if [ -f /etc/profile.d/java.sh ]; then . /etc/profile.d/java.sh fi
. /etc/profile.d/rocks-condor.sh /opt/rocks/bin/rocks report host condor config &hostname; | /opt/rocks/bin/rocks report script | /bin/sh
apache ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: /bin/cat /var/opt/condor/pool_password
